name: Documentation Creation Workflow
description: Complete documentation creation workflow covering README, API docs, user guides, examples, and documentation review.

steps.name: Documentation Planning
steps.task: Analyze the codebase and create a documentation plan. Identify target audience, required documentation types (user guide, API reference, tutorials), and structure. Define documentation standards and style guide.

steps.name: README Creation
steps.task: Create a comprehensive README.md. Include project description, features, installation instructions, quick start guide, usage examples, contribution guidelines, and license information.

steps.name: API Documentation
steps.task: Generate API documentation from code comments and docstrings. Document all public APIs with parameters, return types, exceptions, and usage examples. Use appropriate documentation generation tools.

steps.name: User Guide
steps.task: Write detailed user guide covering installation, configuration, usage patterns, and common workflows. Include screenshots, diagrams, and step-by-step instructions where helpful.

steps.name: Code Examples
steps.task: Create practical code examples demonstrating key features and usage patterns. Write executable examples, add comments explaining the code, and include expected output.

steps.name: Tutorials
steps.task: Create step-by-step tutorials for common use cases and workflows. Structure tutorials progressively from basic to advanced concepts. Include exercises and challenges.

steps.name: Contributing Guide
steps.task: Write CONTRIBUTING.md covering development setup, coding standards, testing guidelines, pull request process, and code review expectations. Help contributors get started quickly.

steps.name: Inline Code Documentation
steps.task: Review and improve inline code documentation. Add missing docstrings, improve existing ones, ensure consistent style, and document complex algorithms and design decisions.

steps.name: Changelog
steps.task: Create CHANGELOG.md documenting version history, new features, bug fixes, breaking changes, and migration guides. Follow semantic versioning conventions.

steps.name: Documentation Review
steps.task: Review all documentation for accuracy, clarity, completeness, and consistency. Test code examples for correctness, verify installation instructions, and check for outdated information.

steps.name: Documentation Site Setup
steps.task: Set up a documentation site using tools like Sphinx, MkDocs, or Docusaurus. Configure theming, search, navigation, and automated builds from markdown.
